definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: This may help you pinpoint what's triggering those hot flashes.
sentences.chinese: 這可能能幫你找到引發潮熱的原因。

sentences.english: She may feel, for example, palpitations and hot flushes.
sentences.chinese: 她也許會感到，舉個例子來說吧，心悸，潮熱。

sentences.english: Will the yellow fever, like the River HuangHe does, bring sorrow to the current regime?
sentences.chinese: 這次的黃潮熱會像黃河氾濫一樣，令到政權害怕嗎？

sentences.english: Hot flashes are the most common symptom of menopause.
sentences.chinese: 潮熱症是更年期的一個普遍症狀。

sentences.english: Dressing in layers to easily shed clothes and alleviate hot flashes.
sentences.chinese: 選擇多層次且容易脫的衣服減輕潮熱。

sentences.english: Fatigue turned to exhaustion, joined by headaches and hot flushes.
sentences.chinese: 疲勞漸漸變成了精疲力竭，還伴隨着頭痛和潮熱。

sentences.english: Sleeping in a cool room to avoid sleep disturbances from hot flashes.
sentences.chinese: 睡在涼爽的房間裏避免潮熱引起的睡眠障礙。

sentences.english: Conclusion GLS is effective in the treatment of redness of climacteric syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 結論GLS對試驗性更年期潮熱證具有治療作用。

sentences.english: Using prescription antidepressants to relieve depression and hot flashes.
sentences.chinese: 使用抗抑鬱藥減輕抑鬱症和潮熱。

definition: to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
chest and hypochondrium/upper part of the body
